intro: Lindsaea novoguineensis, commonly known as the New Guinea lindsaea, is a species of epiphytic fern belonging to the family Bromeliaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of New Guinea and is characterized by its delicate, strap-like leaves that form a rosette structure. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or white in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found growing on trees or rocks in the understory of rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
